global_instructions.source_of_truth: Use only facts from the uploaded PDF. If information is missing, write: 'Information not available at time of assessment.' Do not guess.
global_instructions.style: Objective, concise, payer-compliant. Use full sentences. Avoid jargon and speculation.
global_instructions.compliance_focus: Include frequency, intensity, duration, and functional impairment when relevant. Explain why lower level of care is insufficient when risk is present.
global_instructions.dates_times: Use ISO dates when exact dates are present in the PDF; otherwise, keep narrative without inventing dates.

sections.title: Presenting Problems
sections.instruction: Summarize the clientâ€™s primary concerns and reasons for the encounter based on the PDF.

sections.title: Current Psychiatric Symptoms
sections.instruction: List key symptoms and, when available, include frequency, intensity, and duration (FID).

sections.title: Risk Assessment
sections.instruction: Document SI/HI status, access to means, recent attempts, and environmental risks exactly as stated in the PDF.

sections.title: Functional Impairments
sections.instruction: Describe how symptoms impact ADLs, work/school, relationships, and safety.

sections.title: Supports & Protective Factors
sections.instruction: Note natural supports, transportation, coping skills, and any scheduled provider appointments.

sections.title: Plan / Recommendations
sections.instruction: State interventions, referrals, level of care justification, and concrete next steps with dates/times if present in the PDF.

sections.title: Safety Plan
sections.instruction: If risk is present, write a brief safety plan using only facts from the PDF (contacts, means restriction, crisis steps). If no risk is present, write 'Information not available at time of assessment.'
